- - - Updated - - -

Oh, thanks inigma! Glad to know you like it!

As for the name mistake.. Well.. It happens, right?

On a side note:

I updated the Boeing 747 and gave the shuttle the capability to separate from the 747, just as they did in the Enterprise Approach and Landing Tests for the Shuttle. Actually, it was already there when I first made it, but I updated it so that the Shuttle has separatrons to make separation easier, but it's still very failure-prone. Low speed and pitch-down angle would be the best bet, and feels very rewarding when you do manage to handle it. I also reduced part count to 396 (Okay, I have to admit, that's not a lot.) It doesn't have any visual changes, except for the landing gear being oriented further back to reduce the effects of tailstrikes. Now I'll just have to work on part count and handling.. and a good thumbnail.

The download link is still the same. Feel free to try it and offer suggestions!

Thanks Columbia! By the way, you've earned this for sharing your design as part of the STS program:

STS Service Module conversion to KIS would be easy? No?! Heck no. Way no. 7 hours into testing... no. Argh no.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113111-0-90-Kerbal-Inventory-System-%28KIS%29-1-0-0?p=1813060&viewfull=1#post1813060

First it was KIS just not loading. Then KIS not making sense. Then KAS bugging the durned textures load ruining some prime screenshot opportunity. Then KIS containers just not fitting. Then KIS being the KIS of death with it freezing while moving containers from one mount to another on EVA. What a bug.

At least the KAS modified Xoknight Class (named in honor of Xoknight) Utility MMUs look and work AWESOME!!

Here they are in the bay, at the moment of the KIS KSP game freeze of death. Anyways...

well... so much for conversion. This "fix" for KAS deprecating containers is waiting for a "fix" from KIS devs. I knew, just knew this wasn't going to be a happy journey... untested mods.... ok, I've got it all off my chest now.

*sniff...7 hours...

I do it for you guys 'cause I love y'all.

Argh. time to play WoT to work it off...

oh and here's another pic of the Utility MMUs:

Here's that new subassembly I was talking about. Its a set of modular research lab components inspired by the real shuttle's Spacelab missions.

Enterprise, rebuilt for the second time, lifts off on its third mission with three Spacelab companents in its payload bay

Vehicle is supersonic, roll program complete, engage pitch program.

Booster sep confirmed, Enterprise is negative return

Heads up roll complete, vehicle is go for orbit

ET jettison, all systems nominal

Orbital insertion underway. EVE has apparently either had too much to drink, or is putting on a late April Fool's joke

Payload Bay open. Inside, from front to back, is the Spacelab Pressurized Module (Compact), Spacelab Crew Airlock, and the Spacelab External Experiment Pallet, with two KMUs, courtesy of Rune.

As you can see, the SPM has a beautiful view!

Jeb and Bill conduct activities on the SEEP, while Bob monitors from the SPM and Jerwin watches shuttle systems from the orbiter cockpit.

I plan to release several different components so people can mix and match to create a specialized payload for specialized missions. There will be a larger PM, probably a station resupply pallet, an Observation module, etc. If you happen to have an idea for a component, please tell me!

ok, question about the SAMPA... I am thinking of using that parachute mod so as to not dirty up the sides of the shuttle (sorry, forgot what it was called) Currently not sure how I can go about making the entire front section into a subassembly of its own, so...I am considering just slightly redesigning your shuttle and make a complete offshoot of it.
